Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: 38 In this contribution , we reported a new series of donor polymer materials based on benzodithiophene ( BDT ) and difluorinated dialkylthienylbenzothiadiazole , PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) , which exhibited strong aggregation behavior in both solution and thin films.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| benzodithiophene (BDT) |
| PffBB-n (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) |

Note: I have removed the word "difluorinated dialkylthienylbenzothiadiazole" as it is a description of the chemical structure of the material rather than a clear material name.

This entity is a series of donor polymer materials with specific properties and structures. The other entity, "benzodithiophene (BDT)", is a building block or component of the donor polymer materials, but it is not a material property itself. Therefore, I removed it from the list.
